info.title: search-api
info.description:
A common endpoint for searching across article, draft, learningpath, image and audio APIs.

The Search API provides a common endpoint for searching across the article, draft, learningpath, image and audio APIs. The search does a free text search in data and metadata. It is also possible to search targeted at specific meta-data fields like language or license.
Note that the query parameter is based on the Elasticsearch simple search language. For more information, see https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/query-dsl-simple-query-string-query.html

get.summary: Search across multiple groups of learning resources
get.description: Search across multiple groups of learning resources

parameters.name: query
parameters.description: Return only results with content matching the specified query.

parameters.name: resource-types
parameters.description: A comma separated list of resource-types the learning resources should be grouped by.

parameters.name: page
parameters.description: The page number of the search hits to display.

parameters.name: page-size
parameters.description: The number of search hits to display for each page. Defaults to 10 and max is 10000.

parameters.name: language
parameters.description: The ISO 639-1 language code describing language.

parameters.name: fallback
parameters.description: Fallback to existing language if language is specified.

parameters.name: subjects
parameters.description: A comma separated list of subjects the learning resources should be filtered by.

parameters.name: sort
parameters.description:
The sorting used on results.
             The following are supported: -relevance, relevance, -title, title, -lastUpdated, lastUpdated, -id, id, -duration, duration, revisionDate, -revisionDate, responsibleLastUpdated, -responsibleLastUpdated, status, -status, -prioritized, prioritized, -parentTopicName, parentTopicName, -primaryRoot, primaryRoot, -resourceType, resourceType, -published, published, -favorited, favorited. Default is by -relevance (desc).

parameters.name: ids
parameters.description: Return only learning resources that have one of the provided ids. To provide multiple ids, separate by comma (,).

parameters.name: context-types
parameters.description: A comma separated list of types the learning resources should be filtered by. Available values is standard, topic-article, frontpage-article, learningpath, concept, gloss

parameters.name: language-filter
parameters.description: A comma separated list of ISO 639-1 language codes that the learning resource can be available in.

parameters.name: relevance
parameters.description:
A comma separated list of relevances the learning resources should be filtered by.
If subjects are specified the learning resource must have specified relevances in relation to a specified subject.
If levels are specified the learning resource must have specified relevances in relation to a specified level.

parameters.name: missing-group
parameters.description: Whether to include group without resource-types for group-search. Defaults to false.

parameters.name: aggregate-paths
parameters.description: List of index-paths that should be term-aggregated and returned in result.

parameters.name: grep-codes
parameters.description: A comma separated list of codes from GREP API the resources should be filtered by.

parameters.name: traits
parameters.description: A comma separated list of traits the resources should be filtered by.

parameters.name: embed-resource
parameters.description: Return only results with embed data-resource the specified resource. Can specify multiple with a comma separated list to filter for one of the embed types.

parameters.name: embed-id
parameters.description: Return only results with embed data-resource_id, data-videoid or data-url with the specified id.

parameters.name: filter-inactive
parameters.description: Filter out inactive taxonomy contexts.

parameters.name: FeideAuthorization
parameters.description: Header containing FEIDE access token.

get.description:
Shows all draft learning resources. You can search too.
Query parameters are undocumented, but are the same as the body for the POST endpoint, except `kebab-case`.

post.description: Shows all draft learning resources. You can search too.

post.summary: List subjects with aggregated data about their contents
post.description: List subjects with aggregated data about their contents

parameters.name: codes
parameters.description: Grep codes to find replacements for. To provide codes ids, separate by comma (,).

root.description: Name of the root node this context is in.

rootId.description: Id of the root node this context is in.

path.description: Path to the resource in this context.

breadcrumbs.description: Breadcrumbs of path to the resource in this context.

isPrimary.description: Whether this context is the primary connection

CommentDTO.title: CommentDTO
CommentDTO.description: Information about a comment attached to an article

updated.description: When the comment was last updated

isOpen.description: If the comment is open or closed

solved.description: If the comment is solved or not

description.description: The freetext description of the resource

language.description: ISO 639-1 code that represents the language used in title

lastUpdated.description: Date of when the responsible editor was last updated

page.description: The page number of the search hits to display.

pageSize.description: The number of search hits to display for each page.

articleTypes.description: A list of article-types the search should be filtered by.

contextTypes.description: A list of context-types the learning resources should be filtered by.

language.description: The ISO 639-1 language code describing language.

ids.description: Return only learning resources that have one of the provided ids.

resourceTypes.description: Return only learning resources of specific type(s).

license.description: Return only results with provided license.

query.description: Return only results with content matching the specified query.

noteQuery.description: Return only results with notes matching the specified note-query.

fallback.description: Fallback to existing language if language is specified.

subjects.description: A comma separated list of subjects the learning resources should be filtered by.

languageFilter.description: A list of ISO 639-1 language codes that the learning resource can be available in.

relevance.description:
A list of relevances the learning resources should be filtered by.
If subjects are specified the learning resource must have specified relevances in relation to a specified subject.
If levels are specified the learning resource must have specified relevances in relation to a specified level.

scrollId.description:
A unique string obtained from a search you want to keep scrolling in. To obtain one from a search, provide one of the following values: ["0", "initial", "start", "first"].
When scrolling, the parameters from the initial search is used, except in the case of 'language' and 'fallback'.
This value may change between scrolls. Always use the one in the latest scroll result.

draftStatus.description: List of statuses to filter by. A draft only needs to have one of the available statuses to be included in result (OR).

users.description:
List of users to filter by.
The value to search for is the user-id from Auth0.
UpdatedBy on article and user in editorial-notes are searched.

grepCodes.description: A list of codes from GREP API the resources should be filtered by.

traits.description: A comma separated list of traits the resources should be filtered by.

aggregatePaths.description: List of index-paths that should be term-aggregated and returned in result.

embedResource.description: Return only results with embed data-resource the specified resource. Can specify multiple with a comma separated list to filter for one of the embed types.

embedId.description: Return only results with embed data-resource_id, data-videoid or data-url with the specified id.

includeOtherStatuses.description: Whether or not to include the 'other' status field when filtering with 'status' param.

revisionDateFrom.description: Return only results having next revision after this date.

revisionDateTo.description: Return only results having next revision before this date.

excludeRevisionLog.description: Set to true to avoid including hits from the revision history log.

responsibleIds.description: List of responsible ids to filter by (OR filter).

prioritized.description: Set to true to only return prioritized articles

priority.description: List of priority-levels to filter by.

topics.description: A list of parent topics the learning resources should be filtered by.

publishedDateFrom.description: Return only results having published date after this date.

publishedDateTo.description: Return only results having published date before this date.

resultTypes.description: Types of hits to appear in the result

code.description: Code stating the type of error

MultiSearchSummaryDTO.description: Short summary of information about the resource

id.description: The unique id of the resource

metaDescription.description: The meta description of the resource

score.description: Relevance score. The higher the score, the better the document matches your search criteria.

highlights.description: List of objects describing matched field with matching words emphasized

prioritized.description: If the article should be prioritized

sumOtherDocCount.description: Number of documents with values that didn't appear in the aggregation. (Will only happen if there are more than 50 different values)

docCountErrorUpperBound.description: The result is approximate, this gives an approximation of potential errors. (Specifics here: https://www.elastic.co/guide/en/elasticsearch/reference/current/search-aggregations-bucket-terms-aggregation.html#search-aggregations-bucket-terms-aggregation-approximate-counts)

When scrolling, the parameters from the initial search is used, except in the case of 'language' and 'fallback'.
This value may change between scrolls. Always use the one in the latest scroll result.
